content: how easy and cheerful room hey crafters I don't know about you but
I get a lot of this polyethylene kind of shipping material and it's like a closed
cell type thing but it's a little flexible so it's unlike styrofoam in
that way but it has some great texture so I measured these out a half an inch
by one inch and I'm just gonna cut them out into bricks okay and look at that
what a great texture on there he's gonna make some great ruins okay I just have
some cardboard here I'm gonna cut it out in kind of an ovoid shape here or cut
off the ends and that'll be my base and I'm just gonna use my glue gun and cover
up that those corrugations on the base just go around with my glue gun and then
I'll a little bit of texture on the top of the base here that'll be nice because
it's gonna be open ground so it'll give a nice texture on there just kind of
smear that hot glue out on the top there now I'm gonna start gluing these bricks
on so I'll just use the hot glue gun and just start arranging them there we go
they stick really well with the hot glue remember these are ruined so you're not
trying to make them too nice all right cut a little bit off that one so it
looks like a broken brick and put one over there like that cool so now I'm
going to use the tip of the glue gun it does melt the foam a little bit so I'm
gonna push into it and kind of do some Mars on the surface and that would be a
nice little deep extra detail there and then I'm gonna cover the top with hot
glue that'll give it some extra strength because these aren't super strong so
that will give us some extra strength and stability
all right nice all right did another one with a door arch really cool really nice
and I just cut bricks in half to do the edges of the door there and I just left
a two or I used two bricks for the top there so pretty cool now I'm gonna add
my construction sand to the mix here just put some white glue on there so
glue all put some on the top because it is broken ruins and we'll let that dry
up cool it's been dried and black bombed and I panned the base with a dark brown
and now I'm whatever with a lighter brown to kind of bring out the detail of
the base you can see the rubble we got on there as well as the hot glue texture
and I add some burnt sienna and tan here to add some different color to the ruins
and I'm gonna start drive kind of dry brushing these this gray on over the top
and look at that texture that is I love the texture on that's so fantastic just
built right in you don't have to do anything and here we use the our light
gray and do some highlights here on the edges and then in the middle of some of
the bricks wow really pops that out now I'm going to use some pencil shavings
you guys have seen me do this before I'm going to mix it with glue all water down
glue all and this will give a slush of these pencil shavings which are perfect
for flocking on on bases and I love it because you can what I do is I paint it
after I put it on that dries and this will actually give some extra strength
of this this slushie will actually give some extra strength so now it's dried up
I'm gonna use a off green here and paint those patches of moss and grass that
have grown into the ruins so there we go really cool so let's hit our table get a
look at these bad boys see you there here are ruins all set up at a nice seam
really cool looking here's some adventures for scale as a really nice as
that polyethylene packaging has some really
detail and look at that that the detail of the bricks that's so fantastic I
really didn't do anything except a little bit of marring on the surface
with the hot glue gun and just gives a really nice effect with minimal effort
now I wouldn't I don't think I'd build a whole huge building with these because
they're not super stable they are squishy but when you add the hot glue to
the top and you add the glue soaked pencil shavings it really stiffens them
up a bit and they're good for applications like this perfect for
applications like this so I hope you enjoyed this and another great way to
recycle materials that we're just going to end up in the landfill happy crafting
guys
